intro: Mauria suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented mauria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant fragrance.
